com.github.andreptb.fitnesse.util

Class SeleniumElementFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.andreptb.fitnesse.util.SeleniumElementFinder

  • public class SeleniumElementFinder
extends Object
    Utility class to parse locators and find elements

      static class  SeleniumElementFinder.SeleniumLocator

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public org.openqa.selenium.WebElement find(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                  String locator,
                                  int timeoutInSeconds)
        Tries to selects element, waiting until is available. If locator is null, tries to return the current active (focused) element if there is one
        Parameters:
        driver - instance of WebDriver
        locator - to be parsed
        timeoutInSeconds - time to wait for element
        Returns:
        instance of WebElement found
        Throws:
        org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException - if timeoutInSeconds is exceeded and nothing is found
        See Also:
        waitUntilFind(WebDriver, int, ExpectedCondition)

      • findAttribute

        public String findAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                   String locator,
                   int timeoutInSeconds)
        Tries to get an element's attribute, waiting until is available. If the element selector part of the locator is empty, tries to return the current active (focused) element if there is one
        Parameters:
        driver - instance of WebDriver
        locator - to be parsed
        timeoutInSeconds - time to wait for element
        Returns:
        attribute value
        Throws:
        org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException - if timeoutInSeconds is exceeded and nothing is found

      • presentOrAbsent

        public boolean presentOrAbsent(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                      String locator,
                      int timeoutInSeconds,
                      boolean ensurePresent)
        Returns if an element or an element's attribute with given locator is present or absent, depending of ensurePresent argument.
        Parameters:
        driver - instance of WebDriver
        locator - to be parsed
        timeoutInSeconds - time to wait for element
        ensurePresence - if true checks if the element is present on the page. Otherwise checks if the element is absent of the page
        Returns:
        if an element or attribute with given locator is present on the page
